snippet: The new president, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, won 52 percent of the votes, with 98 percent counted.
lead_paragraph: The new president, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, won 52 percent of the votes, with 98 percent counted.
abstract: Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa is elected president of Portugal, winning about 52 percent of votes; center-right leader is expected to counterbalance Socialist government of Prime Min Antonio Costa.

headline.print_headline: In Portugal, Voters Pick President From Right
headline.main: In Portugal, Voters Pick Center-Right President
